columns.dc:description: Original variable name(s), separated by '&' if applicable
columns.name: original.names

columns.dc:description: Is this an original variable?
columns.name: original.variables

columns.dc:description: Is this a variable for the design+logically curated Mega-Merge dataset?
columns.name: design.logical

columns.dc:description: Is this a variable for the design+logically+statistically curated Mega-Merge dataset?
columns.name: design.logical.statistical

columns.dc:description: Associated modification ID(s) resulting in creation, modification or deletion of this variable if applicable, separated by ';' if applicable
columns.name: modification.IDs

columns.dc:description: Associated modification ID(s) that did not result on action on this variable if applicable, separated by ';' if applicable
columns.name: associated.modification.IDs.without.resulting.action

columns.dc:description: Known remaining dependencies after statistical treatment, referenced by a tested modification ID, separated by ';' if applicable
columns.name: known.remaining.dependencies.after.statistical.treatment

columns.dc:description: Suspected but untestable dependencies, referenced by a tested modification ID, separated by ';' if applicable
columns.name: suspected.but.untestable.dependencies

columns.dc:description: Networks of dependencies encompassing more than two variables, separated by ';' if applicable
columns.name: networks.of.dependencies

columns.dc:description: Recode operation type (relevant for R)
columns.name: recode.operation.type

columns.dc:description: Is this variable conditioned on any aspect in language being present/absent (e.g. another variable) - human readable
columns.name: condition.human.readable

columns.dc:description: Specification of condition, if variable is conditioned
columns.name: condition.if.variable.conditioned

columns.dc:description: Which variable should be the first to be prioritised in case of conflict, in case the generated variable is a merged variable comprising data from several original variables?
columns.name: first.priority.variable.if.merged

columns.dc:description: Which variable should be the second to be prioritised in case of conflict, in case the generated variable is a merged variable comprising data from several original variables?
columns.name: second.priority.variable.if.merged

columns.dc:description: Which variable should be the third to be prioritised in case of conflict, in case the generated variable is a merged variable comprising data from at least 3 original variables?
columns.name: third.priority.variable.if.merged

columns.dc:description: Which variable should be the fourth to be prioritised in case of conflict, in case the generated variable is a merged variable comprising data from 4 original variables?
columns.name: fourth.priority.variable.if.merged

columns.dc:description: Code for creating meta-variable or for executing special recode of a merged variable, written in R. The code is preceded by an index (number plus space), which is parsed using the columns new.levels and recode.pattern to generate the new variable coding from the original variables.
columns.name: recode.operation.Rcode

columns.dc:description: Variable levels in the original variable, preceded by an index (number plus space), which is parsed using the columns new.levels and recode.pattern to generate the new variable coding from the original variable(s).
columns.name: original.levels

columns.dc:description: Variable levels for the new variable â€“ their order is relevant for parsing using the columns recode.operation.Rcode or original.levels and recode.pattern to generate the new variable coding from the original variable(s).
columns.name: new.levels

columns.dc:description: Pattern for recoding original variable(s) to new variable: The indices [separated by '/' if applicable] refer to the ordered cases specified in column recode.operation.Rcode or to the ordered levels in column original.levels. They are converted to the state in new.levels that matches their position with respect to the separator(s) '-' in this column.
columns.name: recode.pattern

columns.dc:description: Does this variable relate to grammar (morphosyntax), phonology or the lexicon?
columns.name: domain

columns.dc:description: The parameter or variable the code belongs to.
columns.name: new.name

columns.dc:description: Modification type: design, logical or statistical
columns.name: modification.type

columns.dc:description: Modification ID
columns.name: modification.ID

columns.dc:description: Comment elaborating design decisions, if applicable (design-manual and design-automated modification.type only)
columns.name: design.decision

columns.dc:description: Expectation tested, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: expectation.tested

columns.dc:description: Motivation for test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: motivation.for.test

columns.dc:description: Source(s) motivating test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: source

columns.dc:description: Is statistical action or logging necessary, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)?
columns.name: statistical.action.or.logging.necessary

columns.dc:description: Flag whether or not statistically motivated action is required: 'yes' if 'yes' to variables relative.overlap.vsmall.in.vlarge.sufficient, sufficient.samples.applicable.for.test, passes.bell.test and passes.cohens.d, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: requires.statistically.motivated.action

columns.dc:description: Flag whether or not a dependency logging in known.remaining.dependencies is supported: 'yes' if maximum.cohensd >= 1.3 , if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: logging.in.known.remaining.dependencies

columns.dc:description: Flag whether or not the relative overlap in languages between the smaller and the larger variable is sufficient to trust any computed proportions from tests: 'yes' if column relative.overlap.vsmall.in.vlarge > 0.3, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: relative.overlap.vsmall.in.vlarge.sufficient

columns.dc:description: Flag whether sufficient samples (>= 20) can be evaluated, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: sufficient.samples.applicable.for.test

columns.dc:description: Is the bell curve value sufficiently low: 'yes' if column maximum.sum >= 0.2, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)?
columns.name: passes.bell.test

columns.dc:description: Is there a very high effect size: 'yes' if column minimum.cohensd >= 1.3, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: passes.cohens.d

columns.dc:description: Modifications or dependence logging resulting from test or design decision, if applicable
columns.name: resulting.modification

columns.dc:description: Variables associated with modification, if applicable
columns.name: relevant.variables

columns.dc:description: Variables added through modification.ID, if applicable
columns.name: resulting.added.variables

columns.dc:description: Are the variable(s) added through the modification.ID kept in the design/logical curation, if applicable
columns.name: is.added.variable.kept

columns.dc:description: Variables removed through modification.ID, if applicable
columns.name: resulting.removed.variables

columns.dc:description: Variable 1 participating in test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: variable.1.for.test

columns.dc:description: Variable 2 participating in test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: variable.2.for.test

columns.dc:description: Type of test (XOR, AND or THEN), if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: test

columns.dc:description: State of variable 1 which is subject to a statistical association test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: v1.equals.for.test

columns.dc:description: Anti-state of variable 1 which is subject to a statistical association test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: v1.unequals.for.test

columns.dc:description: State of variable 2 which is subject to a statistical association test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: v2.equals.for.test

columns.dc:description: Anti-state of variable 2 which is subject to a statistical association test, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: v2.unequals.for.test

columns.dc:description: Number of languages coded (not '?' or NA) for variable 1, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: nr.lgs.v1

columns.dc:description: Number of languages coded (not '?' or NA) for variable 2, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: nr.lgs.v2

columns.dc:description: Number of languages coded (not '?' or NA) in both variables, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: absolute.overlap.v1.v2

columns.dc:description: Proportion of languages coded (not '?' or NA) in the smaller variable, which is also coded in the larger variable, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: relative.overlap.vsmall.in.vlarge

columns.dc:description: Proportion of languages coded (not '?' or NA) in the larger variable, which is also coded in the smaller variable, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: relative.overlap.vlarge.in.vsmall

columns.dc:description: Number of samples discarded for the test, because under 1/3 of the languages in the applicable state of v1 are not also coded for v2
columns.name: samples.disregarded.insufficient.lgs.applicable

columns.dc:description: Number of samples assessed (max. 1000), if applicable (statistical modification.type only). The sum of samples.disregarded.insufficient.lgs.applicable and samples.assessed is always 1000.
columns.name: samples.assessed

columns.dc:description: Mean of the only (THEN test) or first (XOR and AND tests) conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: mean.d1.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Standard deviation of the only (THEN test) or first (XOR and AND tests) conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: sd.d1.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Sum of mean plus standard deviation of the only (THEN test) or first (XOR and AND tests) conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: mean.plus.sd.d1.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Mean of the second conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type of test type AND or XOR only)
columns.name: mean.d2.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Standard deviation of the second conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type of test type AND or XOR only)
columns.name: sd.d2.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Sum of mean plus standard deviation of the second conditional probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type of test type AND or XOR only)
columns.name: mean.plus.sd.d2.across.tested.samples

columns.dc:description: Mean of the only (THEN test) or first (XOR and AND tests) marginal probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: mean.baseline.1

columns.dc:description: Mean of the second marginal probability across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type of test type AND or XOR only)
columns.name: mean.baseline.2

columns.dc:description: Effect size strength (paired Cohen's D value) between of the only (THEN test) or first (XOR and AND tests) conditional and marginal probabilities across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: d1.baseline1.cohensd

columns.dc:description: Effect size strength (paired Cohen's D value) between of the second conditional and marginal probabilities across tested samples, if applicable (statistical modification.type of test type AND or XOR only)
columns.name: d2.baseline2.cohensd

columns.dc:description: The only or worse (higher) of the two sum values (mean.plus.sd.d1.across.tested.samples and mean.plus.sd.d2.across.tested.samples), if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: maximum.sum

columns.dc:description: The only or worse (lower) of the two Cohen's D values (d1.baseline1.cohensd and d2.baseline2.cohensd), if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: minimum.cohensd

columns.dc:description: The only or better (lower) of the two sum values (mean.plus.sd.d1.across.tested.samples and mean.plus.sd.d2.across.tested.samples), if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: minimum.sum

columns.dc:description: The only or better (higher) of the two Cohen's D values (d1.baseline1.cohensd and d2.baseline2.cohensd), if applicable (statistical modification.type only)
columns.name: maximum.cohensd
